articles.title: Emmanuel Macron warns of ‘disintegration’ risk to world order in Xi Jinping meeting - Financial Times
articles.description: Two leaders stress need for multilateralism amid rising trade tensions

articles.title: Harden 'just as shocked as you guys' by CP3 news - ESPN
articles.description: Clippers stars Kawhi Leonard and James Harden said Wednesday night they were both "shocked" when they learned earlier that morning Chris Paul would no longer be their teammate.

articles.title: People worldwide don’t know enough about menopause. Here’s why that’s dangerous - CNN
articles.description: Menopause has a wide range of symptoms and brings several health risks. Yet people worldwide know little about it and awareness and care services remain inadequate, experts warn.

articles.title: Survivors in boat strike were trying to climb back onto vessel before follow-up attack, source says - CBS News
articles.description: The White House confirmed this week that there was a second strike, but denied that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth ordered it.

articles.title: What to know about Minnesota fraud allegations, as Trump levels attacks on Walz - CBS News
articles.description: President Trump has recently attacked Gov. Tim Walz over the fraud cases, calling Minnesota a "hub of fraudulent money laundering activity" and lashing out against the state's Somali community.

articles.title: Quentin Tarantino: Paul Dano Is 'Weakest Male Actor in SAG' - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: The Oscar winner called Dano "weak sauce" when discussing his picks for the best films of the 21st century on 'The Bret Easton Ellis Podcast.'

articles.title: How Belgium became Russia’s most valuable asset - politico.eu
articles.description: Belgian Prime Minister Bart De Wever is unmoved in his opposition to a raid on Moscow’s funds held in a Brussels bank to support a loan to Ukraine.

articles.title: Trump's lawmaker pardon list stretches beyond Henry Cuellar - Axios
articles.description: A dozen members of Congress — a vast majority of whom are former lawmakers — have received pardons.

articles.title: Mike Johnson faces widespread Republican revolt - Axios
articles.description: One member called Johnson a "political novice."

articles.title: Steve Cropper, guitarist and member of Stax Records' Booker T and the M.G.'s, dies - NPR
articles.description: Steve Cropper, who co-wrote classics including "(Sittin' on) the Dock of the Bay" and "In the Midnight Hour" during his years playing guitar at the legendary Stax Records in Memphis, has died. He was 84.

articles.title: Trump announces plans to weaken fuel efficiency rules for cars and trucks - The Washington Post
articles.description: Executives from Ford, GM and Stellantis joined the president as he announced plans to roll back rules pushing automakers to sell more electric cars.

articles.title: Investigation into pre-Budget leaks is under way, MPs told - BBC
articles.description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves has given her "full support" to  a review of security processes around the lead-up to the Budget.

articles.title: How Minnesota became a hub for Somali immigrants in the U.S. - NPR
articles.description: Minnesota boasts the largest population of Somalis in the U.S. — a community that's recently faced attacks from President Trump. Here's a brief history of how they came to settle there.

articles.title: Trump says Witkoff and Kushner had "a very good" meeting with Putin - Axios
articles.description: Trump said their impression was that Putin wants "to see the war ended," but it wasn't clear what progress had been made in the talks.

articles.title: Meta poaches Apple design exec Alan Dye to lead new creative studio in Reality Labs - TechCrunch
articles.description: Dye led Apple's user interface team for the last decade.

articles.title: Nvidia’s Huang Unsure Whether China Would Accept H200 Chips - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said he’s unsure whether China would accept the company’s H200 artificial intelligence chips should the US relax restrictions on sales of the processors, following a meeting Wednesday with President Donald Tru…

articles.title: Miley Cyrus confirms engagement to musician Maxx Morando - BBC
articles.description: The Grammy winner says she was "so surprised" after her partner of four years proposed on a trip.

articles.title: Admins and defenders gird themselves against maximum-severity server vuln - Ars Technica
articles.description: Open source React executes malicious code with malformed HTML—no authentication needed.
